p: Even though vaccinating domestic horses has markedly decreased the annual incidence in South Africa compared to pre-vaccination levels [ 6], AHS still remains endemic in most of the country, with approximately 500 cases reported annually in domestic equids [ 2]. In contrast, only sporadic outbreaks have occurred within the AHS controlled area, mostly linked to the re-assortment and/or reversion to virulence of the live attenuated AHS vaccine in use in the country [ 7].
